Nahh, higher-level elves can take some real hits, and their rocks can be 
devastating when they pile up in a closed area. (Of course an archer or mage 
can just fire at the rocks until they disappear, but a cleric is helpless. 
Blobs and towers are pretty harmless if you're careful, but one hit from a 
high-level tower can kill a careless player, and blobs are durned hard to 
damage. As far as one-on-one combat goes, I think that skeletons and fairies 
are the weakest. A skeleton can chase you around throwing bones and such, 
but if you face it in close combat it's pretty hard to lose. Fairies, even 
the highest level fairies, do little damage hand-to-hand. Remember 
Tinkerhew, from TevFifty? A pushover. (That is, unless it freezes you long 
enough for the golems to throw some rocks at you... ugh.)

DPH... I've been too busy with websites to try your latest levels (I have to 
open them all in Scen and rename them as my characters have already done 
levels with those numbers). I will soon, though, and give you my critique.

Did anyone take my suggestion about Gladiator fan-fics? I haven't started 
mine, but I will soon. I promise.

  -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
